pullRequest.body:
Let `B` be an `A`-algebra. Then

- `B` is faithfully flat over `A` if and only if it is flat and induces a surjective map on prime spectra.
- If `B` is flat and local over `A`, it is faithfully flat.

Co-authored by: Sihan Su <ssh@stu.pku.edu.cn>
Co-authored by: Yi Song <sif4delta0@mail.ustc.edu.cn>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20700~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20715~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21497~~
* leanprover-community/mathlib4#21498
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
@erdOne: I have opened #21497 and #21498 for the splitting.

I agree, it is not easy to find a good place for it though. I now moved it to `RingTheory.Spectrum.Prime.Basic` which causes +20% imports there, because it needs `RingTheory.Ideal.Over`, but I am reluctant to make a new file for this. `find_home!` yields
```
[Mathlib.RingTheory.Jacobson.Ring, Mathlib.RingTheory.Spectrum.Prime.Topology, Mathlib.RingTheory.Valuation.LocalSubring, Mathlib.RingTheory.DedekindDomain.Ideal]
```
but neither of these look reasonable to me.
In that case can you maybe split `RingTheory.Ideal.Over`?
This looks similar to `Module.tensorProduct_mk_one_injective_of_isScalarTower` in the other file.
Oops, forgot to remove that one.
Since it is `RingHom.specComap` I renamed it to `of_specComap_surjective` instead.

```suggestion
/-- If `A` is local and `B` is a local, flat `A`-algebra, then `B` is faithfully flat. -/
```
Does this file still need anything about localizations?
Yes, but this is not the issue with the remaining `big import`. I'll need to get rid of the finiteness and polynomials.
Ah, I think I found a different solution. We don't need `Ideal.Over` anymore in `Spectrum.Prime.RingHom` if we move one lemma in a different place.

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/FaithfullyFlat): equivalent characterizations for algebras

`+ surjective_iff_exact`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
